resources.string:
Weather variables

• Temperature, Daily rainfall total, Wind speed, Relative humidity, Atmospheric pressure, Condition.

Source

• World Weather Online provides the source data
• Data may at times not reflect reality - this is an unfortuante consequence of using free data

Updating

• The data source updates every half-hour, at 0 and 30 minutes past the hour
• There is an automatic service to fetch this data at the user-specified interval
• The manual refresh can be used to force the automatic service to check the data source for updates
• Use the manual refresh if the automatic procedure fails or auto-updates are turned off
• Only data for those citites that are selected is retrieved - less than 1KB each update.

General

• This is the second release of the app - Version 2.0 (Aug 2013)
• Please report bugs and send feature suggestions & feedback via the homepage or relevant app store
• App homepage
• Developed by Ben Lee-Rodgers of nw3weather.co.uk.
• Images / icons are either freely available (Creative Commons 0) or were created by me in GIMP.

Future updates

I do not anticipate making any further non-essential updates to this app.
If you are a developer and wish to continue development, all code is available in my Github repository

Home screen

• Nine cities with their current weather are shown on colour-coded tiles
• Tiles are automatically arranged in a 'compass view' according to the cities' coordinates (the most westerly cities are on the left).
• The colour depends on the weather variable and the absolute value displayed (e.g. blue for low temperature, red for high)
• Clicking a tile takes you to the 'city detail' (see below)
• To change the weather variable (rain, wind...): swipe left/right or click one of the buttons in the dark purple bar.

The blue menu bar:
    • Settings - change units or update preferences
    • Table - go to the table view of all available cities (see below)
    • Map Marker - go to the city changer map screen to change the displayed cities (see below)
    • Refresh - manually check for data (more info in 'data' tab)
    • Help - view help and other basic documentation

City Detail

• All data for the city is displayed, using the same colour-coding as the home screen
• Swipe left/right to change the displayed city.

Table View

• View data for all available cities (now 151)
• Click on column headers to sort
• Click on table head to change variable
• Highlighted rows are cities currently in your collection
• Toggle the inclusion of non-European cities on and off.
• Internet connection is required to view live data.

City Changer

• Over 100 cities around Europe are marked.
• Bonus 15+ global cities too.
• Currently selected cities are in pink
• Click a red marker to select the city for use.
